name: Riad Malika

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: My sister and I had a wonderful 3 night stay back in July and our whole experience was perfect from beginning to end. The taxi was ready and waiting at the airport and after a short journey, we had a fantastic meal ready when we were that evening. Riad Malika is a perfect escape from the busy Marrakesh streets with beautiful courtyard gardens and a very refreshing pool to escape to in the heat of the day. Our room was luxurious with fantastic rooftop views and the breakfasts were the best we ever had! We felt incredibly safe and secure and have absolutely no complaints about our stay there, except that we wish we could have stayed for longer! Thank you for a wonderful stay!
reviews.title: Perfection

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From the moment we entered the Riad after a gruelling two hour wait through customs we knew it was going to be just what we needed at the end of a long day travelling, so quiet and peaceful. We were welcomed with a smiling face and served a beautiful meal set in the tranquil centre garden of the Riad. Our room didn't dissapoint and was so beautiful with traditional decor throughout and a huge comfortable bed covered in rose petals, what more could you want ?. The staff were always happy to help with anything we required including transport whenever needed. On our day of departure we were required to vacate our room at 12:00 noon to allow for new arrivals but we were kindly allowed to wait at the Riad and use the facilities and waiter service until our flight late in the evening.
reviews.title: Wonderful Malika

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Thank you so much Riad Malika.
reviews.title: Magical Malika

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: From our arrival at the airport after a chaotic passport control experience, we were greeted by our driver (supplied by Malika) Yaya and treated to an entertaining journey to Riad Malika. As we entered the Riad, we were greeted by the wonderful Rashid and the magic began. The room was fantastic, and once settled we dined at a table in the courtyard strewn with rose petals... fantastic food - from the Moroccan Fish to the breakfasts every morning - there could be no faults found in any aspect of the services provided..... it was like waking up in a film set every day, and the tranquility provided within the walls of the Riad compared to the hectic-ness of the Medina outside provided a welcome respite. Our only disappointment was that we were visiting Marrakech for a friends wedding and were staying until the Sunday and when we booked the Riad was actually full on the Saturday night so we had to spend our final night in Morocco somewhere else.... we have already resolved to return next year with our son and there is nowhere else we would consider staying.... we cannot wait to return.... Many Thanks x
reviews.title: Loved it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: The décor is lovely, and the staff are both unobtrusive and there when you need them, (they even kept the kitchen open late for us on our day of arrival when we experienced delays at the airport). The home cooked food was excellent. Relaxing and calm, the riad is located in an ideal place to explore without being too difficult to get back to! They have their own spa facilities and we would recommend the hamman body scrub and massage - fabulous!
reviews.title: The Best of Everything

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stay 3 nights in this Riad, and was a fantastic experience.
reviews.title: Incredible!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff was extremly friendly and help you in all the things that you need.
reviews.title: Oasis in Marrakech

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled with family
reviews.title: Fabulous experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Fantastic small riad in the heart of the Medina area. Behind the front door you find a tranquil garden area, beautifully decorated rooms and a pool which is just what you need after a hot day exploring the souks. The manager was very friendly and helpful. He organised a great day trip to the Atlas Mountains for us. The room was lovely, the beds comfortable, the internet service good, and the breakfast tasty and varied.
reviews.title: A dream stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The riad is in walking distance of the main square, but is a little hard to return to. particularly at night, so its best to explore for the first time in the day light. Also take advantage of the hotels offer to collect you at the airport/station as the riad is not easy to find on your own.
reviews.title: Exceptional place with three-storey room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have no hesitation in recommending this riad to visitors to Martrakech. It was exactly what we were looking for: central location, peaceful haven, comfortable room with a great terrace for relaxation. Very pleased that we chose the suite with its large bedroom and bathroom and the breakfast was pretty good too. The riad is well maintained and the service is very efficient. Breakfast was varied each morning which was most welcome as I despair of eating the same food each day in a hotel that one is staying in for a week.
reviews.title: A very good stay.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I really can't see why anyone would prefer an international branded hotel over a riad with such colour and character. Of course there are always things that could be improved: a mini bar/fridge in the room, a telephone to order drinks (it is forbidden to bring food and drink into the hotel), more comfortable chairs in the suite rather than the 1970s polyester swivel chair and proper mixer taps rather than separate hot and cold taps in the shower which seems to offer two options - scolding hot or freezing cold.It would also be an idea to make it clearer to guests that cash is preferred over cards (and maybe offer a discount as is done in Turkey), that way guests could be more prepared with a better commission charge.
reviews.title: Good Value Riyadh

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Despite these small gripes, I would warmly recommend the Riad Malika. You won't regret it!
reviews.title: A great place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our second time in Marrakech and we chose Riyadh Malika because of the reviews and a personal recommendation from a friend. We stayed in one of the suites. The room was lovely - large with two bathrooms, a lounge and a covered courtyard. The bedroom was good and sleep quality was excellent. The call to prayer at 5am each morning that woke us up was actually a feature rather than an inconvenience. The location of the Riyadh is very good and only 10 - 15 minutes walk from the main market. Even walking back late at night felt very safe. We ate twice in the evenings at the Riyadh and both nights the food quality was very good. The Riyadh has a homely feel to it and the two main guys who oversaw everything were friendly and accommodating. The quality of the breakfasts was a disappointment having read the reviews. Basically yoghurt, jam and a selection of breads. There was no hot option for the breakfast (although when we did ask for some eggs they did quite happily make us an omelette). We would recommend this Riyadh as good value for money
reviews.title: Perfect Honeymoon

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at Riad Malika for 1 week in the second week of September. The riad has a homely feel to it with the comforts of a hotel. We stayed in one of the standard double rooms as it was the only one available at the time, but this was by no means a 'box room'. The staff were very helpful and pleasant. A special thanks to Rashid who was very helpful with everything.
reviews.title: lovely homely place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013
reviews.text: As if you are invited to a beautiful typical moroccan house, with numerous details in the interior and a living soul. Amazing place, unforgettable attitude. The nearest parking is in front of Maison de arab (people in the streets know is place, can help to find the riad). You can trust the staffs recommendations regarding the restraunts and night life (both were exactly what we asked for).
reviews.title: Amazing stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A very well located Rian in the middle of the Medina. After the hectics a very welcome oasis. Very friendly people and nice rooms, especially the suits.
reviews.title: Excellent place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We loved our stay very much.
reviews.title: Calm, tranquil and a heavenly oasis

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Thanks for the warm welcome and we hope to come back sometime.
reviews.title: True paradise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We stayed here for a week for my partner's 40th birthday and it was just beautiful. We stayed in the Royal Suite and were blown away at how gorgeous it was. The pictures online really don't do it justice.
reviews.title: Heavenly haven!

description: One of the first charmed hotel in Marrakech, located in a historic place of the Medina, a few steps from the famous Dar el Bacha, Riad Malika offers, in a subtle blend of "Art Deco" and traditional moroccan art, 10 luxurious rooms, patios, its swimming pool, hammam and its beautiful gardens shaded.
